blogs.title: Programmatic approach to Machine Learning
blogs.text: There are lots of definitions for Machine Learning and I would like to use the most basic definition: it’s a process in which the machine is learning (not going much deep for a better definition because there are many more important things). The learning can be classified into 4 for easier understanding: 1. Supervised Learning 2. Unsupervised Learning 3. Semi-supervised Learning 4. Reinforcement Learning

blogs.title: Supervised Learning for Classification problem
blogs.text: In supervised learning, a set of inputs and corresponding outputs will be given to the machine. The machine is supposed to find a function that will give the desired output for all the inputs. In classification problems, the output will be having discrete values.

blogs.title: Supervised Learning for Regression problem
blogs.text: In supervised learning, a set of inputs and corresponding outputs will be given to the machine. The machine is supposed to find a function that will give the desired output for all the inputs. In regression problems, the output will be having continuous values.

blogs.text: Jenkins is an open-source tool to automate tasks. Here are the commands to install Jenkins in Linux with ‘apt-get’ as per the official site of Jenkins: wget -q -O - https://pkg.jenkins.io/debian/jenkins-ci.org.key | sudo apt-key add -

blogs.title: Cloud hosting providers and web server software
blogs.text: Cloud hosting is a cloud computing service that comes under IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service). In this service, you will be given a remote computer in which you can do various operations that you do on a normal computer.

blogs.title: Apache Tomcat
blogs.text: Basic installation steps: 1. Install Java: sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install default-jdk; 2. Find the latest version of Tomcat 8 at the Tomcat 8 Downloads page (http://tomcat.apache.org/download-80.cgi). Under the Binary Distributions section, then under the Core list, copy the link to the “tar.gz”. Install it.
